question: How much mortgage can I afford with an annual income of $80,000 and monthly debts of $500?
true_answer: With an income of $80,000 and monthly debts of $500, you can afford a mortgage of approximately $280,000, assuming a 30-year term and a 3.5% interest rate.

steps.content: How much mortgage can I afford with an annual income of $80,000 and monthly debts of $500?
Plan: 1) Use home_loan_agent to assess affordability criteria. 2) Use calculator to compute potential mortgage. 3) Confirm with supervisor if needed. 4) Provide recommendation.
Standard criteria include a DTI ratio under 36% and housing expenses under 28% of gross income.
Credit check: No negative impact on affordability calculation.
Calculating maximum affordable mortgage based on given income and debts.
Using housing expenses to estimate maximum mortgage size.
Estimated maximum mortgage size is approximately $280,000.
What interest rate is this calculation assuming?
Calculation assumes a 30-year term with a 3.5% interest rate.
With an income of $80,000 and monthly debts of $500, you can afford a mortgage of approximately $280,000, assuming a 30-year term and a 3.5% interest rate.
